intro: Cinchona calisaya var. ledgeriana, commonly known as the Ledger's quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and ornamental flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it is closely related to other cinchona species used in the production of quinine. Its botanical features make it valuable for both ornamental horticulture and medicinal research.
